questions.question: Samuel ……………………… he was quitting.
questions.description: That can be omitted after common reporting verbs.

questions.question: I ………………………. you are right.
questions.description: That can be omitted after common reporting verbs.

questions.question: The dentist ……………………….. I should change my toothbrush.
questions.description: That can be omitted after common reporting verbs.

questions.question: Rahul ………………………. he was not interested in the offer.
questions.description: That cannot be dropped after replied.

questions.question: She ………………………… she was quitting.
questions.description: That cannot be dropped after shout.

questions.question: I agree with the ……………………. education should be free for all.
questions.description: That cannot be dropped after nouns.

questions.question: I’m ……………………….. you are safe.
questions.description: Some adjectives can be followed by that-clauses. That can be left out after common adjectives.

questions.question: We were …………………………… he lost.
questions.description: That can be dropped after common adjectives.

questions.question: Come in quietly ……………………….. the child does not wake up.
questions.description: That can be left out in some common two-word conjunctions.

questions.question: You can borrow my car ……………………….. you bring it back before midnight.
questions.description: That can be left out after provided.

questions.question: This is the girl ………………………. met in the store.
questions.description: When that is the object of the relative clause it can be left out.

questions.question: We were having such a nice time …………………….. extended the holiday by another two days.
questions.description: That can be left from such …. that.
